JobFullDesc: Location: Anywhere in USJob Overview:We are currently looking to add a self-motivated professional to our passionate, innovative, and results-driven E-discovery, Forensics & Investigations Team. The Team is deeply committed to the protection of the Deloitte brand, our practitioners, and our clients. What you will doPerform evidence collection (on site and remotely), digital evidence preservation, processing, and maintaining chain of custody Perform comprehensive analysis of digital evidence for a variety of workstation, server, mobile platforms, and a variety of log solutions Document and generate examination reports to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders; and provide actionable recommendations when necessary Contribute to the overall process improvement of investigation policies and processes Collaborate with leadership and stakeholders, including, but not limited to, internal clients such as legal, talent, insider threat, incident response, and cyber security leadership Keep up-to-date of emerging digital forensic and investigation trends, technologies, and techniques Evaluate, test, recommend, and integrate new Electronic Discovery and/or Computer Forensic tools and technologies Develop unique and creative solutions to problems on the fly to successfully perform mission critical tasks The teamInformation Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS is the engine that helps to drive Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.The ~2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services internally including:Cyber security Technology support Technology & Infrastructure Application development and management Relationship management group Strategy Deployment PMO Financials Communications  Cyber Security The Cyber Security team is responsible for vigilantly protecting Deloitte and client data. The team is responsible for a strategic cyber risk program that adapts to a rapidly changing threat landscape, changes in business strategies, risks, and vulnerabilities. Using situational awareness, threat intelligence, and building a security culture across the organization, the team helps to protect the Deloitte brand.Areas of focus include:Cyber design Risk & Compliance  Technology Risk Management Identity & Access Management Data Protection Incident Response and Architecture Qualifications:Proven track record of 8+ years in any combination of roles as a Security Analyst, Incident Responder, Forensic Examiner, and / or Enterprise Mail Administrator Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience Verifiable skills performing computer and systems related investigations Strong communication, interpersonal, analytical and problem solving skills Strong understanding of forensic artifacts, operating systems, and platforms Practical knowledge of high-level scripting/programming language (Python, Perl, PowerShell, etc.) to extract, de-obfuscate, or manipulate data Understanding of Email and various OS; Windows, MAC OSX, Linux, iOS, Android Forensic tools: SIFT workstation; EnCase, FTK, Axiom, Intella, Etc. Certifications: Industry Forensic, Investigation, or Cyber Security Certifications (e.g. GCFE, GCFA)
